intro: Limodoron fasciolum, commonly known as the banded liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its leafy, thalloid structure and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant exhibits a distinctive banded or zoned appearance on its thallus, which is a defining morphological feature. It reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporophytes. Limodoron fasciolum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various small organisms.
